licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans for this
licensing period.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported significant support from administration and believe they
are being provided training that help their ability to provide best care for the youth.
All staff also reported the program is very supportive of the youth and staff.
All three youth in the program were interviewed and they reported feeling safe at
the facility. They also reported the program is helping them and providing ways
they can change their behaviors. They believe the staff are attentive to their needs
and provide support when needed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This program is in a single-story building attached to the Eaton County Juvenile
Center and separated by locked doors. The program is clean and excellently
maintained. All plumbing is in working order and well furnished. The menu is posted
as required as are all required postings. Medications are locked as required and
medication logs are appropriate. Emergency drills and room logs are being
completed per compliance requirements. Cleaning supplies are also locked.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
1/27/2025
